# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

#Task
Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}

**Balatro Decision Time**

Okay, so the game wants me to pick the next move. Let's see... I'm at Ante 4 of 8, Round 9, right in the shop phase. Things are a bit tight, I'm at -$20, which is the absolute limit thanks to that Credit Card, so no wiggle room there.

I've got six Jokers in play: Ride the Bus, Acrobat, Midas Mask (which is kind of a dud right now), the Credit Card (lifesaver!), Onyx Agate, and Sixth Sense. The shop? Not much to look at. Two Standard Packs at $4 each (forget it), a Seed Money Voucher for $10 (also a no-go), and I just bought Sixth Sense. Reroll is out of the question, too expensive.

Realistically, I can't buy anything. I'm maxed out on debt. So, the only possible move is to go to the next round. My plan is to start with a single 6 to trigger Sixth Sense, hoping to get some spectral cards out of it.

I should probably rearrange my Jokers, though. I *always* want to optimize the additive multipliers before the multiplicative ones. So, Ride the Bus (+28 Mult), Onyx Agate (+7 per club), and then Acrobat (x3).

The prompt says played cards and modifiers come before the held-in-hand bonuses.

So the score order should be: Played Cards -> Ride the Bus -> Onyx Agate -> Acrobat (on the final hand).

Current: Ride the Bus, Acrobat, Midas Mask, Credit Card, Onyx Agate, Sixth Sense.

Ideally, the order would be: Ride the Bus, Onyx Agate, Acrobat. The Midas Mask and Credit Card don't affect scoring.

But, I'm in the shop. I can rearrange, but I can't *do* anything else.

Let's do the Joker shuffle to optimize.
1. Ride the Bus
2. Onyx Agate
3. Acrobat
4. Midas Mask
5. Credit Card
6. Sixth Sense

Since I'm in the shop, I might as well rearrange the Jokers now. It's the most efficient thing to do.

Okay, let's just go to the next round, there's nothing else I can do right now. Action: `round_select`.
